description.narrative: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is the increased access to finance for SMEs and HEVs. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment has the potential to increase Costa Ricas competitiveness by increasing access to climate finance for climate-smart vehicles through demonstration and replication.

The proposed project consists of a senior secured financing package for up to US$30 million comprised of: (i) a senior secured A Loan in an amount of up to US$20 million, for IFCs own account, including US$10 million of unfunded credit risk participation from credit insurance (CIP) and (ii) an up to US$10 million mobilization package through a senior secured B1 loan and/or parallel loan for Corporacion CAFSA, S.A., Financiera CAFSA, S.A., and Arrendadora CAFSA, S.A. (altogether CAFSA or the Company) in Costa Rica. The purpose of the investment is to support the growth of CAFSAs financing and leasing portfolios for i) small and medium enterprises (SMEs) that seek financing solutions to acquire vehicles and ii) for the purchase of hybrid and/or electric cars (HEV), which are expected to represent at least 25% of the proceeds (the Project).
